articles.title: Migration on the Move: The Race to the U.S. Border Pre-Trump Era
articles.description: Hundreds of migrants in southern Mexico await bus transfers under a Mexican government program to reach the U.S. before Donald Trump takes office. They rely on CBP One, a humanitarian initiative by President Joe Biden, to enter legally amidst fears of Trump's policy changes.
articles.content:
In southern Mexico, migrants are queuing in large numbers outside immigration offices, eager to secure safe passage to the United States before the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump in January.
